metadata.description:
The data set contains the data of meteorological gradient observation system of sidaqiao superstation downstream of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2015 to December 31, 2015.The station is located in the four Bridges of dalaihubu town, ejin banner, Inner Mongolia.The latitude and longitude of the observation point are 101.1374e, 42.0012n, and 873m above sea level.Air temperature, relative humidity and wind speed sensors are installed at 5m, 7m, 10m, 15m, 20m and 28m, with a total of 6 layers, facing due north.The wind sensor is installed at 15m, facing due north;The barometer is installed in the waterproof box;Dump-type rain gauge installed at 28m;The four-component radiometer is installed at 10m, facing due south;The two infrared thermometers are installed at 10m, facing due south, and the probe is facing vertically down.The two photosynthetic effective radiometers are installed at a location of 10m, facing due south, with the probes pointing vertically up and down, respectively.Part of the soil sensor is installed at 2m to the south of the tower body, in which the soil heat flow plate (self-calibration formal) (3 pieces) is successively buried at 6cm underground;The average soil temperature sensor TCAV is buried 2cm and 4cm underground.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground.The soil moisture sensors were embedded in the ground at 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm.
The observation items are: wind speed (WS_5m, WS_7m, WS_10m, WS_15m, WS_20m, WS_28m) (unit: m/s), wind direction (WD_15m) (unit: degree), air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, Ta_7m, Ta_10m, Ta_15m, Ta_20m, Ta_28m and RH_5m, RH_7m, RH_10m, RH_15m, RH_20m, RH_28m) (unit: Celsius, percentage), air pressure (Press) (unit:Hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit: c), up and down the photosynthetic active radiation (PAR_U_up, PAR_U_down) (unit: second micromoles/m2), the average soil temperature (TCAV) (unit: c), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit:W/m2), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit: volume water content, percentage), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (unit: Celsius).
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10min). If data is missing, it will be marked by -6999;Infrared temperature 1 between February 11, 2015 and April 25, 2015 due to sensor problems, data is missing;The soil temperature of 4cm was between October 8, 2015 and October 29, 2015. Due to sensor problems, the data was missing.(2) eliminate the moments with duplicate records;(3) data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked by red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2015-9-10-10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
Please refer to Li et al. (2013) for hydrometeorological network or site information, and Liu et al. (2011) for observation data processing.

该数据集包含了2015年1月1日至2015年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网下游四道桥超级站气象要素梯度观测系统数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是柽柳。观测点的经纬度是101.1374E, 42.0012N，海拔873m。空气温度、相对湿度、风速传感器分别架设在5m、7m、10m、15m、20m、28m处，共6层，朝向正北；风向传感器架设在15m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在28m处；四分量辐射仪安装在10m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在10m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在10m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个；土壤部分传感器安装在塔体南侧2m处，其中土壤热流板（自校正式）（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处；平均土壤温度传感器TCAV埋设在地下2cm、4cm处；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm和160cm处；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm和160cm处。
观测项目有：风速（WS_5m、WS_7m、WS_10m、WS_15m、WS_20m、WS_28m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_15m）(单位：度)、空气温湿度（Ta_5m、Ta_7m、Ta_10m、Ta_15m、Ta_20m、Ta_28m和RH_5m、RH_7m、RH_10m、RH_15m、RH_20m、RH_28m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、向上和向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、平均土壤温度（TCAV）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；红外温度1在2015.2.11-4.25之间由于传感器的问题，数据缺失；4cm土壤温度在2015.10.8-10.29之间由于传感器的问题，数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波文比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观察到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体是通过观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度的过高估计。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获取的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）及其在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中的蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）的比率，该实验是河西水文遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早、中、晚生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其在发展中国家尤为明显（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，先前的研究发现，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'energy balance closure' mean in the context of eddy covariance flux measurements?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在涡度协方差通量测量的背景下，“能量平衡闭合”指的是测量的能量输入和输出之间的平衡。
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of eddy covariance flux measurements, 'energy balance closure' refers to the condition where the sum of the measured turbulent fluxes of sensible and latent heat equals the available energy, which is the net radiation minus the ground heat flux. An incomplete energy balance closure indicates discrepancies in measurements, often due to errors in component fluxes or missing fluxes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在涡动协方差通量测量的背景下，“能量平衡闭合”指的是测得的感热和潜热的湍流通量之和等于可用能量，即净辐射减去地面热通量。能量平衡闭合不完全表明测量存在差异，通常是由于组分通量的误差或缺失通量所致。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the data collection method at the 四道桥超级站 compare with the methods used in the Daman superstation in terms of measuring meteorological parameters and soil characteristics?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 四道桥超级站的数据收集方法与达曼超级站在测量气象参数和土壤特性方面的方法有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The data collection at the 四道桥超级站 involves multiple layers of sensors for measuring wind speed, temperature, humidity, and other meteorological parameters at various heights and depths, whereas the Daman superstation utilizes a 40-m boundary layer tower with measurements at specific heights and includes the use of a thermal infrared camera for soil and canopy temperature observations.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 四道桥超级站的数据收集涉及多个层次的传感器，用于在不同高度和深度测量风速、温度、湿度以及其他气象参数，而达曼超级站则利用一座40米的边界层塔，在特定高度进行测量，并使用热红外相机观察土壤和冠层温度。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in ensuring the accuracy of soil and canopy component temperature measurements for evapotranspiration estimation models?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在确保土壤和冠层成分温度测量的准确性以进行蒸散发估计模型时，可能会出现哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges include errors in image classification which can affect the separation of soil and canopy pixels, leading to inaccurate temperature estimations. Additionally, atmospheric conditions such as upwelling radiation and transmittance can introduce uncertainties in temperature data, impacting the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 挑战包括图像分类中的错误，这可能影响土壤和树冠像素的分离，从而导致温度估算不准确。此外，大气条件如上行辐射和透射率可能会引入温度数据的不确定性，影响蒸散发估算的准确性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can long-term observational data enhance our understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据如何增强我们对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational data provide critical insights into the interactions between oasis and desert systems, helping researchers understand the dynamics of energy exchange and carbon balance. Such data are crucial for assessing ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in arid regions, particularly in the context of climate change.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 长期的观察数据为研究绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用提供了重要的见解，帮助研究人员理解能量交换和碳平衡的动态。这些数据对于评估生态稳定性和支持干旱地区的可持续发展至关重要，特别是在气候变化的背景下。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the methodological considerations for collecting consistent hydrometeorological data in arid and semi-arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区收集一致的水文气象数据时，需要考虑的方法论因素包括：
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Methodological considerations include using automatic weather stations for reliable data on radiation, soil heat flux, air temperature, and humidity gradients. Ensuring consistent data collection involves quality control procedures like data processing and archiving, and managing challenges like ecological degradation in sensitive environments.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 方法论考虑包括使用自动气象站以获取关于辐射、土壤热通量、空气温度和湿度梯度的可靠数据。确保数据收集的一致性涉及质量控制程序，如数据处理和归档，以及管理在敏感环境中生态退化等挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the challenges in accurately measuring E and T in arid regions using ground-based methods?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，使用地面方法准确测量蒸散发（E）和蒸发（T）面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: In arid regions, challenges in measuring E and T accurately using ground-based methods are primarily caused by the limitations of composite temperature separation approaches. Errors in derived component temperatures are often due to image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance. Additionally, the presence of a strongly advective environment and uncertainties in both the TSEB model and the EC system contribute to measurement difficulties.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，使用地面方法准确测量蒸散发（E）和蒸腾（T）面临的挑战主要源于复合温度分离方法的局限性。推导的组成温度中的误差通常是由于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。此外，强烈的平流环境以及TSEB模型和EC系统中的不确定性也增加了测量的困难。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why are long-term observations essential for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are essential for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems because these measurements are crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions. Such understanding supports ecological stability and socioeconomic development, which are critical for achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals in these regions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要，因为这些测量对于识别绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。这种理解支持生态稳定和社会经济发展，这对于实现这些地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the causes of environmental degradation in inland river basins of arid and semiarid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域环境退化的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Environmental degradation in inland river basins of arid and semiarid regions is caused by factors such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These issues are particularly pronounced in areas westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin, the Aral Sea basin, and the Lake Urmia basin.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域的环境退化是由多种因素造成的，例如河流和湖泊的干涸、自然植被的退化、土地沙漠化的加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些问题在丝绸之路沿线的西部地区尤为明显，如塔里木河流域、阿拉尔海流域和乌尔米耶湖流域。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of integrating multiple measurement techniques, such as eddy covariance systems and thermal infrared cameras, on the reliability of energy and water vapor flux estimations in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将多个测量技术（如涡度协方差系统和热红外相机）整合在一起，可能对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量和水汽通量估算的可靠性产生哪些潜在影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating multiple measurement techniques, such as eddy covariance systems and thermal infrared cameras, can enhance the reliability of energy and water vapor flux estimations by allowing for more accurate separation of soil and canopy component temperatures. This integration helps in better validating the estimates of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration, especially in strongly advective environments, by providing robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculations.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合多种测量技术，如涡度协方差系统和热红外相机，可以提高能量和水蒸气通量估算的可靠性，通过更准确地分离土壤和冠层组件的温度。这种整合有助于更好地验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的估算，特别是在强烈的平流环境中，通过提供稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might long-term observational datasets from oasis-desert systems impact our understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes in arid and semi-arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 长期观察性数据集来自绿洲-沙漠系统，可能会影响我们对干旱和半干旱地区能量、水汽和碳交换过程的理解。
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets from oasis-desert systems provide critical insights into the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes, which are essential for understanding oasis-desert interactions. These datasets enable the analysis of trends over time, contributing to ecological stability, socioeconomic development, and the achievement of carbon peaking and neutrality goals. They also support the management of natural resources and the sustainable development of oases.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的长期观测数据集为理解能量、水汽和碳交换过程提供了关键见解，这些过程对理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。这些数据集使得对趋势的时间分析成为可能，有助于生态稳定、社会经济发展以及实现碳达峰和碳中和目标。它们还支持自然资源管理和绿洲的可持续发展。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of using ground-based measurements to validate TSEB model estimates in heterogeneous landscapes with varying vegetation types and coverage?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在具有不同植被类型和覆盖度的异质景观中，使用地面测量来验证TSEB模型估计的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using ground-based measurements to validate TSEB model estimates in heterogeneous landscapes can lead to improved accuracy in separating soil and canopy latent heat fluxes and enhance the estimation of energy partitioning. This approach provides better validation of evapotranspiration components, helping to refine models for various vegetation types and coverage, and potentially improving water resource management and the understanding of the terrestrial water cycle in these landscapes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用地面测量数据来验证TSEB模型在异质景观中的估计，可以提高土壤和冠层潜热通量的分离精度，并增强能量分配的估算。这种方法提供了更好的蒸散发成分验证，有助于细化针对不同植被类型和覆盖度的模型，潜在地改善水资源管理和对这些景观中陆地水循环的理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the goal of establishing a meteorological observation network with multiple sensor layers for measuring atmospheric and soil parameters in an oasis-desert environment?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠环境中建立多层传感器的气象观测网络，以测量大气和土壤参数的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to achieve a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and supporting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases. Long-term observations are indispensable for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in such areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是实现对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用以及支持绿洲的生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。长期观测对于实现这些地区碳达峰和碳中和的目标是不可或缺的。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to use a series TSEB model with high-resolution thermal camera inputs to estimate soil and canopy component temperatures in agricultural areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率热成像相机输入的系列TSEB模型来估计农业区域的土壤和冠层组件温度的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important because the model can accurately estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration by separating soil and vegetation component temperatures, particularly in strongly advection-irrigated agricultural areas. This separation provides reliable estimates that are crucial for understanding surface fluxes and improving water resource management.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 这很重要，因为该模型可以通过分离土壤和植被成分的温度，准确估计蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发，特别是在强烈的平流灌溉农业地区。这种分离提供了可靠的估计，对于理解表面通量和改善水资源管理至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What observational technologies enable the collection of detailed meteorological and soil data in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些观测技术能够在干旱地区收集详细的气象和土壤数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Observational technologies such as eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations enable the collection of detailed meteorological and soil data. These systems measure turbulent fluxes, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 观测技术如涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站能够收集详细的气象和土壤数据。这些系统测量湍流通量、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What factors might contribute to the difficulty in obtaining reliable ground-based measurements of evaporation and transpiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，获取可靠的地面蒸发和蒸腾测量的困难可能由以下因素造成：
Expectation.AnswerEn: Obtaining reliable ground-based measurements of evaporation and transpiration in heterogeneous landscapes can be difficult due to the spatial variability in soil and vegetation properties. This heterogeneity affects energy exchange processes and can lead to errors in composite temperature measurements. Additionally, arid regions are characterized by strong advective conditions that can further complicate measurements. The uncertainty in determining surface-air temperature differences and the limitations of current models, which may not accommodate all necessary parameters and observations, are also significant factors.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中获得可靠的地面蒸发和蒸腾测量可能很困难，因为土壤和植被特性的空间变异性会影响能量交换过程，并可能导致复合温度测量的误差。此外，干旱地区的强大平流条件也会进一步 complicate 测量。确定表面与空气温度差异的不确定性以及当前模型的局限性（可能无法考虑所有必要的参数和观测）也是重要因素。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the perceived challenges in ensuring data quality and consistency across different stations within a hydrometeorological observation network?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 确保水文气象观测网络中不同站点的数据质量和一致性所面临的挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Ensuring data quality and consistency across different stations involves tackling challenges such as data loss due to sensor failures, as highlighted by instances of data missing from infrared temperature and soil temperature sensors. Moreover, data must be processed to remove duplicates, values that exceed expected ranges, and ensure format uniformity. These processes are crucial for maintaining a reliable dataset, but they require meticulous attention to detail and robust quality control protocols.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 确保不同站点之间数据质量和一致性涉及解决诸如传感器故障导致的数据丢失等挑战，例如红外温度和土壤温度传感器的数据缺失。此外，数据必须经过处理，以去除重复值、超出预期范围的值，并确保格式统一。这些过程对于维护可靠的数据集至关重要，但它们需要细致的关注和强有力的质量控制协议。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: Can the existing datasets and observational frameworks be deemed sufficient for advancing research on evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 现有的数据集和观测框架是否足以推动对异质景观中蒸散发研究的进展？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The existing datasets and observational frameworks appear to be well-suited for advancing research on evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes. The datasets include detailed measurements of meteorological parameters, soil and canopy temperatures, and energy fluxes, which are essential for models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. These datasets are validated using ground-based measurements and advanced techniques like stable isotope analysis, suggesting a high level of methodological rigor. However, the complexity of arid and semi-arid regions and challenges in accurate temperature separation indicate that there may still be room for refinement and enhancement in data collection and analysis techniques.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 现有的数据集和观测框架似乎非常适合推动对异质景观中蒸散发的研究。这些数据集包括气象参数、土壤和树冠温度以及能量通量的详细测量，这些都是像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型所必需的。这些数据集通过地面测量和稳定同位素分析等先进技术进行了验证，表明其方法论的严谨性很高。然而，干旱和半干旱地区的复杂性以及准确温度分离的挑战表明，在数据收集和分析技术方面仍然有改进和增强的空间。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how meteorological parameters can be effectively measured every 10 minutes in such a remote location.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在如此偏远的地方如何能有效地每10分钟测量气象参数。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The meteorological parameters can be effectively measured using automatic weather stations, which include sensors for air temperature, wind speed, humidity, and more, allowing for continuous and precise data collection even in remote locations.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 气象参数可以通过自动气象站有效测量，这些站点配备了空气温度、风速、湿度等传感器，能够在偏远地区进行持续和精确的数据收集。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure how the data from different layers and depths of soil can be accurately collected and integrated.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定如何准确收集和整合来自不同层次和深度土壤的数据。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Soil data can be collected using embedded sensors at various depths, such as soil temperature and moisture sensors, which provide continuous data that is integrated using systematic processing techniques to ensure accuracy across different soil layers.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 土壤数据可以通过嵌入式传感器在不同深度收集，例如土壤温度和湿度传感器，这些传感器提供连续的数据，并通过系统化的处理技术进行集成，以确保不同土壤层的准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the challenges of data quality control are addressed in such complex ecological observations.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解在如此复杂的生态观察中，如何解决数据质量控制的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data quality control is addressed through rigorous steps such as ensuring complete data sets, marking missing data, removing duplicates, and identifying outliers, as well as standardizing formats and using indicators for data with potential issues.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制通过严格的步骤来解决，例如确保数据集完整、标记缺失数据、删除重复项、识别异常值，以及标准化格式和使用指示器来处理可能存在问题的数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the data processing and quality control procedures used for collecting hydrometeorological data in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集水文气象数据所使用的数据处理和质量控制程序。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedure involves data collection from automatic weather stations, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. The stations observe various parameters such as radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature, humidity, wind speed, direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Data is collected with a 10-minute average period and supplemented with vegetation and soil parameters.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序包括从自动气象站收集数据、数据处理以及数据归档和共享。这些站点观察各种参数，如辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度、湿度、风速、风向、气压、降水量和土壤湿度剖面。数据以10分钟的平均周期收集，并补充植被和土壤参数。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explain the challenges associated with measuring evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration using the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model in arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型在干旱地区测量蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发面临的挑战包括：
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include the current composite temperature separation approaches being limited in arid regions, errors in derived component temperatures due to image classification errors, and increased uncertainty in the TSEB model. Errors are exacerbated by vegetation abundance, pixel misclassification, and uncertainties in atmospheric radiation and transmittances through canopies.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括当前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的局限性、由于图像分类错误导致的衍生成分温度误差，以及TSEB模型中不确定性的增加。错误因植被丰度、像素误分类以及大气辐射和通过树冠的透射率的不确定性而加剧。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the observational datasets available for studying energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert systems and discuss their components.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请概述可用于研究绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的观测数据集，并讨论它们的组成部分。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The observational datasets from oasis-desert systems include long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, and auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Data is acquired from eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations, covering multiple parameters such as radiation, soil heat flux, air temperature, humidity, wind speed, and soil moisture profiles.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及关于水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。数据通过涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站获取，涵盖多个参数，如辐射、土壤热通量、空气温度、湿度、风速和土壤湿度剖面。
